com.gnahraf.math.stats

Class MovingAverage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gnahraf.math.stats.MovingAverage

  • public class MovingAverage
extends Object
    Keeps track of a moving average over a fixed size window. This class is suited for tracking discrete, integral values. Note the computational complexity of computing the average is independent of the window size.
    Author:
    Babak

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MovingAverage(int windowSize)
      Creates a new instance initialized to zero with the given windowSize.
      MovingAverage(int windowSize, long initValue)
      Creates a new instance with the given windowSize, initialized to the given initValue.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long average()
      Returns the moving average.
      void clear()
      Clears the instance, and initializes the average to zero.
      void clear(long initValue)
      Clears the instance, and initializes the average to the given initValue.
      long count()
      Returns the number of the values observed since the instance was last cleared.
      long lastValue() 
      void observe(long value) 
      double precisionAverage()
      Returns the moving average in double precision.
      long valueAt(int windowIndex) 
      int windowSize()
      Returns the number of elements in the moving average.
